availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Cornwall (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, candlemaker.)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, candlemaker. Native of Ireland. Married to Amelia Bucklin Cornwall in Jefferson County, Kentucky on March 5, 1846. Father of Anna Cornwall and John Cornwall. Merchant in Louisville in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Candlemaker in Louisville in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 177B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 276A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482707.
